Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label a picture showing ice before it melts (solid form).
The student can draw and label a picture showing what happens to ice when it melts to water (liquid form).
The student can draw and label a picture showing water after it has refrozen back into ice (solid form again).
The student can illustrate the process of ice melting and freezing, showing that it can reverse back and forth.
The student can show through their drawing that some changes, like ice melting to water, can be reversed.
